definitions.definition: In legislative assemblies that permit unlimited debate (that is, a filibuster ): a motion , procedure or rule by which debate is ended so that a vote may be taken on the matter. For example, in the United States Senate , a three-fifths majority vote of the body is required to invoke cloture and terminate debate.

main_definition: ( law , politics , chiefly US ) In legislative assemblies that permit unlimited debate (that is, a filibuster ): a motion , procedure or rule by which debate is ended so that a vote may be taken on the matter. For example, in the United States Senate , a three-fifths majority vote of the body is required to invoke cloture and terminate debate.
